fd_greens.main.ansatze module¶

Ansatz construction functions.

fd_greens.main.ansatze.build_ansatz_e(params: Sequence[float]) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Constructs the ansatz for (N+1)-electron states of the encoded Hamiltonian. The ansatz is of the form \((I \otimes R_y(\theta))|10\rangle\).

Parameters

parameters. (A sequence of the) –

Returns

The ansatz quantum circuit.

fd_greens.main.ansatze.build_ansatz_gs(params: Sequence[float]) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Constructs an N-electron ansatz of the encoded Hamiltonian. The ansatz is of the form \((R_y(\theta_2)\otimes R_y(\theta_3)) CZ (R_y(\theta_0)\otimes Ry(\theta_1)) |00\rangle\).

Parameters

parameters. (A sequence of the) –

Returns

The ansatz quantum circuit.

fd_greens.main.eh_amplitudes_solver module¶

Solver for transition amplitudes between ground and (N+/-1)-electron states.

class fd_greens.main.eh_amplitudes_solver.EHAmplitudesSolver(h: fd_greens.main.molecular_hamiltonian.MolecularHamiltonian, q_instance: Optional[qiskit.utils.quantum_instance.QuantumInstance] = None, method: str = 'exact', h5fname: str = 'lih', anc: Sequence[int] = [0, 1], spin: str = 'd', suffix: str = '', verbose: bool = True)¶

Bases: object

A class to calculate transition amplitudes.

build_diagonal() → None¶

Constructs diagonal transition amplitude circuits.

build_off_diagonal() → None¶

Constructs off-diagonal transition amplitude circuits.

execute_diagonal() → None¶

Executes the diagonal circuits circ0 and circ1.

execute_off_diagonal() → None¶

Executes the off-diagonal transition amplitude circuit circ01.

process_diagonal() → None¶

Post-processes diagonal transition amplitude results.

process_off_diagonal() → None¶

Post-processes off-diagonal transition amplitude results.

run(method: Optional[str] = None, build: bool = True, execute: bool = True, process: bool = True) → None¶

Executes all functions to calculate transition amplitudes.

Parameters

  • method – The method to calculate transition amplitudes. Either exact (‘exact’) or tomography (‘tomo’).

  • build – Whether to construct the circuits.

  • execute – Whether to execute the calculations.

  • process – Whether to process the results.

save_data() → None¶

Saves transition amplitudes data to HDF5 file.

fd_greens.main.transpilation.combine_1q_gates(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, qubits: Optional[Iterable[int]] = None) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Combines certain 1q gates to identities on given qubits.

The combination rules used in this function are: H H = I X X = I Rx(theta) Rx(-theta) = I

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit on which 1q gates are to be combined.

  • qubits – Qubit indices on which 1q gates are to be combined.

Returns

The circuit after certain 1q gates are combined.

fd_greens.main.transpilation.convert_1q_to_xpi2(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Converts 1q gates H, X and Ry(theta) to X(pi/2) and virtual Z gates.

The conversion rules are: H = Z(pi/2) X(pi/2) Z(pi/2) X = X(pi/2) X(pi/2) Ry(theta) =

fd_greens.main.transpilation.convert_ccz_to_cixc(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Converts CCZ gates to C0-iX-C0 gates along with other gates.

Each CCZ gate in the original circuit is decomposed into C-iZ-C CSdag(q0, q2). The CSdag(q0, q2) gate is then decomposed into SWAP(q0, q1) CSdag(q1, q2) SWAP(q0, q1), and only one of the SWAP gates is further decomposed into the form in arXiv:xxxx.xxxxx depending on whether it is the even (the one after is decomposed) or odd occurrence (the one in front is decomposed). The latter decomposition is for further simplification of the gates by wrap_swap_gates and simplify_czxcz.

Parameters

gates. (The circuit on which CCZ gates are to be called to C0-iX-C0) –

Returns

The circuit after CCZ gates are called to C0-iX-C0 gates.

fd_greens.main.transpilation.convert_swap_to_cz(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, q_pairs: Optional[Sequence[Tuple[int, int]]] = None, reverse: bool = False) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Converts SWAP gates to CZ and X(pi/2) gates except for the ones at the end.

  • q_pairs –

  • reverse –

  • qubits_subcirc – The qubit indices of the subcircuit.

Returns

The subcircuit instruction tuples. inst_tups_main: The main circuit instruction tuples. barr_loc: The main-circuit locations of the barriers in the subcircuits.

Return type

inst_tups_sub

fd_greens.main.transpilation.transpile_3q(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, circ_label: str, savefig: bool = False) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Performs 3q gate transpilation based on the circuit label.

This function is a wrapper of convert_ccz_to_cixc, which transpiles the CCZ gates in 4q circuits into C0-iX-C0 along with additional 1q and 2q gates.

Parameters

  • circ – The quantum circuit on which 3q gates need to be transpiled.

  • circ_label – The circuit label.

  • savefig – Whether to save the circuit figure after transpilation.

Returns

The quantum circuit after transpiling the 3q gates.

fd_greens.main.transpilation.transpile_into_berkeley_gates(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, circ_label: str, savefig: bool = True) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Transpiles the circuit into the native gates on the Berkeley device.

This is the main function in this module and calls the other functions as subroutines. The basis gates are assumed to be X(pi/2), virtual Z, CS, CZ, and C0-iX-C0. The transpilation procedure depends on the circuit label. This function consists of the following four steps: 1. Permute and add SWAP gates (transpile_permute) 2. Transpile 3q gates (transpile_3q) 3. Transpile 2q gates (transpile_2q) 4. Transpile 1q gates (transpile_1q)

Parameters

  • circ – The quantum circuit to be transpiled.

  • circ_label – The circuit label, e.g. ‘0u’, ‘0d’ etc.

  • savefig – Whether to save the circuit figures.

Returns

The circuit after transpilation.

fd_greens.main.transpilation.transpile_permute(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, circ_label: str, savefig: bool = False) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Performs permutation transpilation based on the circuit label.

This function is a wrapper of permute_qubits, which inserts SWAP gates at specific start and end positions. The start and end positions in this circuit are predetermined based on the circuit label. The goal is to permute qubits so that all multi-qubit gates act on adjacent qubits.

Parameters

  • circ – The quantum circuit to be transpiled.

  • circ_label – The circuit label.

  • savefig – Whether to save the circuit figure after transpilation.

Returns

The quantum circuit after transpilation.

fd_greens.main.transpilation.transpile_subcircuit(circ: qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, qubits_trans: Mapping[Sequence[int], Sequence[str]]) → qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit¶

Transpiles a circuit by transpiling the subcircuits. Performs transpilation of a circuit by first splitting it into subcircuits and then merging.

Parameters

  • circ – The circuit to be transpiled.

  • qubits_trans – A dictionary with qubit indices as the keys and transpilation function strings as the values.

Returns

The circuit after transpilation.

fd_greens.main.transpilation.wrap_swap_gates(circ: Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]]) → Union[qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit, Sequence[Tuple[qiskit.circuit.instruction.Instruction, List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.quantumregister.Qubit]], Optional[List[Union[int, qiskit.circuit.classicalregister.Clbit]]]]]]¶

Exchanges the qubits between two SWAP gates and removes the SWAP gates.

Parameters

transpiled. (A circuit to be) –

Returns

The new circuit after transpilation.

fd_greens.main.z2symmetries module¶

Z2 symmetry transform functions.

fd_greens.main.z2symmetries.cnot_indices(qubit_inds: fd_greens.main.qubit_indices.QubitIndices, ctrl: int, targ: int) → fd_greens.main.qubit_indices.QubitIndices¶

Applies a CNOT operation to qubit indices.

Parameters

  • qubit_inds – The input QubitIndices object.

  • ctrl – Index of the control qubit.

  • targ – Index of the target qubit.

Returns

The QubitIndices object after CNOT is applied.

fd_greens.main.z2symmetries.cnot_pauli(pauli_op: Union[qiskit.opflow.primitive_ops.pauli_sum_op.PauliSumOp, qiskit.quantum_info.operators.symplectic.sparse_pauli_op.SparsePauliOp], ctrl: int, targ: int) → Union[qiskit.opflow.primitive_ops.pauli_sum_op.PauliSumOp, qiskit.quantum_info.operators.symplectic.sparse_pauli_op.SparsePauliOp]¶

Applies a CNOT operation to the Z2 representation of a Pauli operator.

Note that the operator in string form follows Qiskit qubit order, but in vector (PauliTable) form follows normal qubit order. The returned type is the same as the input type, which can be either a PauliSumOp or a SparsePauliOp.

Parameters

  • pauli_op – A Pauli operator on which a CNOT is to be applied.

  • ctrl – An integer indicating the index of the control qubit.

  • targ – An integer indicating the index of the target qubit.

Returns

The new Pauli operator after a CNOT is applied.

fd_greens.main.z2symmetries.swap_indices(qubit_inds: fd_greens.main.qubit_indices.QubitIndices, q1: int, q2: int) → fd_greens.main.qubit_indices.QubitIndices¶

Applies a SWAP operation to qubit indices.

Parameters

  • qubit_inds – The input QubitIndices object.

  • q1 – Index of the first qubit.

  • q2 – Index of the second qubit.

Returns

The QubitIndices object after SWAP is applied.

fd_greens.main.z2symmetries.swap_pauli(pauli_op: Union[qiskit.opflow.primitive_ops.pauli_sum_op.PauliSumOp, qiskit.quantum_info.operators.symplectic.sparse_pauli_op.SparsePauliOp], q1: int, q2: int) → Union[qiskit.opflow.primitive_ops.pauli_sum_op.PauliSumOp, qiskit.quantum_info.operators.symplectic.sparse_pauli_op.SparsePauliOp]¶

Applies a SWAP operation to the Z2 representation of a Pauli operator.

Note that the operator in string form follows Qiskit qubit order, but in vector (PauliTable) form follows normal qubit order. The returned type is the same as the input type, which can be either a PauliSumOp or a SparsePauliOp.

Parameters

  • pauli_op – A Pauli operator on which a SWAP is to be applied.

  • q1 – An integer indicating the first qubit index.

  • q2 – An integer indicating the second qubit index.

Returns

The new Pauli operator after a SWAP is applied.

fd_greens.main.z2symmetries.taper_indices(qubit_inds: fd_greens.main.qubit_indices.QubitIndices, inds_tapered: Sequence[int]) → fd_greens.main.qubit_indices.QubitIndices¶

Tapers certain qubits off in a QubitIndices object.

Parameters

  • qubit_inds – The input QubitIndices object.

  • inds_tapered – The tapered qubit indices.

Returns

The QubitIndices object after tapering.

fd_greens.main.z2symmetries.taper_pauli(pauli_op: Union[qiskit.opflow.primitive_ops.pauli_sum_op.PauliSumOp, qiskit.quantum_info.operators.symplectic.sparse_pauli_op.SparsePauliOp], inds_tapered: Sequence[int], init_state: Optional[Sequence[int]] = None) → Union[qiskit.opflow.primitive_ops.pauli_sum_op.PauliSumOp, qiskit.quantum_info.operators.symplectic.sparse_pauli_op.SparsePauliOp]¶

Tapers certain qubits off a Pauli operator.

Note that the operator in string form follows Qiskit qubit order, but in vector (PauliTable) form follows normal qubit order. THe returned type is the same as the input type, which can be either a PauliSumOp or a SparsePauliOp.

Parameters

  • pauli_op – A Pauli operator on which certain qubits are to be tapered.

  • inds_tapered – Indices of the tapered qubits.

  • init_state – A sequence of 0 and 1 indicating the initial state on the tapered qubits. Default to 0 on all the tapered qubits.

Returns

The new operator after certain qubits are tapered.

fd_greens.main.z2symmetries.transform_4q_indices(qubit_inds: fd_greens.main.qubit_indices.QubitIndices, swap: bool = True, tapered: bool = True) → fd_greens.main.qubit_indices.QubitIndices¶

Transforms 4q qubit indices to 2q qubit indices.

Parameters

  • qubit_inds – The qubit indices.

  • swap – Whether to swap the last two qubits.

  • tapered – Whether to taper off the first two qubits.

Returns

The qubit indices after the transformation.

fd_greens.main.z2symmetries.transform_4q_pauli(pauli_op: Union[qiskit.opflow.primitive_ops.pauli_sum_op.PauliSumOp, qiskit.quantum_info.operators.symplectic.sparse_pauli_op.SparsePauliOp], swap: bool = True, taper: bool = True, init_state: Optional[Sequence[int]] = None) → Union[qiskit.opflow.primitive_ops.pauli_sum_op.PauliSumOp, qiskit.quantum_info.operators.symplectic.sparse_pauli_op.SparsePauliOp]¶

Transforms a 4q pauli operator (or sum of them) to a 2q pauli operators (or sum of them).

THe symmetries are assumed to be ZIZI and IZIZ. The operations applied are CNOT(2, 0), CNOT(3, 1) and SWAP(2, 3), followed by optionally tapering off q0 and q1.

Parameters

  • pauli_op – A four-qubit Pauli operator to be transformed.

  • swap – Whether to swap q2 and q3.

  • taper – Whether to taper q0 and q1.

  • init_state – The initial state on the first two qubits if tapered.

Returns

A two-qubit Pauli operator after transformation if tapered, otherwise a four-qubit Pauli operator.
